intro: Desmostachys planchonianus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact rosette of velvety, waxy leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, often with a distinctive spurred petal. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is widely cultivated as a houseplant.
